title: Tiffany is offering an Advent calendar. The price tag: $112,000
text:
CLOSE

People walking past a Tiffany store in Shanghai. (Photo: Kelly Wang, AFP/Getty Images)

Tiffany's latest idea for counting down to the holidays? A calendar priced at six figures.

The luxury jeweler unveiled its "Ultimate Advent Calendar" with unique pieces of jewelry for each day over a 24-day period. But prepare to splurge: The collection costs $112,000.

The calendar includes 24 items wrapped in the company's signature blue boxes, each ensconced within the Advent calendar that measures more than 4 feet tall, resembling its flagship store on Fifth Avenue in New York City.

Items available in the calendar include an extra large smile pendant in 18-karat rose gold with diamonds, an 18-karat rose gold bracelet with diamonds, and gold earrings. You can view the complete list of items on Tiffany's website.

Tiffany says the Advent calendar is assembled upon delivery using its White Glove Service. Only four of the calendars are available for purchase.

This month, the jeweler launched its first collection for men, and is also expanding to home items such as cocktail shakers and beer mugs.
